My E1 post

### Last Month

- Last month I have chance to work with new things: Web3, art generator, vue/nuxtjs, strapi, moleculer,..

### Result/comment

- It is quite interesting but many things came so I have not had much experience on each part

### Goals for next month

- Complete the work and learn new things, based on the current project (VueJS/NuxtJS)


### Vue/NuxtJS

- vue-chartjs has not supported ChartJS v3. follow this [Issue](https://github.com/apertureless/vue-chartjs/issues/695)
- Stepper text editor can not break new line =))
- Vercel Server less: can not import package into nuxt.config.js
- My project is written by Typescript, but any type for every things. JS is better in this case :))
- there are quite a lot of things of vuejs I need to learn: directive, nuxtjs lifecycles, watcher, computed, slot,... (ReactJS is still my #1 choice)

##### Vue/NuxtJS Pros

- I dont need import my component to each file
- watcher/event system is cool

##### Vue/NuxtJS Con

- Not sure why my localhost is often out of memory (Need to learn more about vuejs)
- Can not use JS optinal chaining inside vue template (may I missed some configs ???)"

New post for S1

Strictly follow TSLint. Any repeated code would be a function or React component. A function only does one thing. A PR should not pass 1k lines change with about 15 files change top. Every front-end PR has images, gif or loom instruction. Most of them are associated with Issue. https://github.com/nanocohub/xshop/pull/2621
Not required in my current project

It's nice that at FE we have cypress now. https://github.com/nanocohub/xshop/runs/5172907825?check_suite_focus=true
However test coverage is quite low so its effect is quite minimal. The main hurdle for higher test coverage is my ability to use FactoryBot (ruby) to create mock data at our test database.
Bugs are fixed on the right priority https://github.com/nanocohub/xshop/pull/2690. Since the test coverage is low, no associated test cases have been fixed so far.

My typical commit is quite small. The commit message is quite meaningful and connect to the task that it does. https://github.com/nanocohub/xshop/pull/2667/commits/7cb7c9bb39b55c11c4ba15cc66732331d007ed89

Most of the time my function only do one thing. Sometimes I might abstract the function to avoid duplicated code. I try my best to balance between readability and DRY. https://github.com/nanocohub/xshop/blob/c9119647ab10dbffecdbff710e0378e6ec2af4de/client/components/CampaignTypeB/helper.ts#L16

 Although the function is well scoped, the duplicated logic has been an issue. For example gift selection code https://github.com/nanocohub/xshop/blob/c9119647ab10dbffecdbff710e0378e6ec2af4de/client/components/AccumulatedCampaignManagement/Modals/AccGiftSelectionItemGroups.tsx#L75

Internal transfer is the major story for this period https://github.com/nanocohub/xshop/issues/2426. We encounter issues with type A and type B campaigns so there has been a change in design and user flow. https://github.com/nanocohub/xshop/issues/2704. Add checking gift inventories https://github.com/nanocohub/xshop/pull/2657
This has been the case for most of my tickets (gh issues) (

This board has reflected my working progress https://github.com/orgs/nanocohub/projects/1/views/1

My standups are the key things I would do during the day. It's written after morning standup to remind myself of my priority and my teamates about what I am doing.

Since I was doing day trading. I made a Python project with Chart and indicators, using Binance API

For next month:

- I will start small and keep doing it as a daily habit
- I will apply for CoderPush tech talk so I will learn new things by sharing and getting advices
- I always tried to write clean, DRY code and think if there is a better way doing a logic
- I'm a positive person. I don't feel bad for not knowing many things. Instead it, hard things mean I'm learning/getting new information
need to do it more regularly

- I kept work logs and do daily raven report

- I keep asking question to gain more knowledge from experienced developers and senior engineer

- I will form a habit to selft study computer science
- I did this many times before but I often quit because I was busy in work, I didn't have a clear plan, I lost my self-discipline

- My PRs follow what, why, how, and QA format
- The what, why, how and how to test are detailed and have meaningful description
- I should create PR, and ask for feedback more frequently
- Practice to make simple and descriptive PRs, avoid unnecessary long/complex description

- Using composition to avoid 'prop drilling'
https://twitter.com/mjackson/status/1195495535483817984

https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1125773153584676864
- Keeping a context value scoped to the area that needs it most has improved performance and maintainability characteristics
- Defining a function for your effect to call, then do it inside the effect callback, not outside
- Pass only primitive value to React.memo components
https://kentcdodds.com/blog"

I learned Netlify

Not really a "major decision" is my life but on the process of cleaning up the repo and setup the new CI/CD, I slowly overcame my fear of raising my personal opinion on how things shoud be done, my team did follow with my solution happily and thats really made me proud of myself. Obviously there is much more room for improvement and my solution might not be perfect, but to have people trust on your opinion..I felt I have grown a lot
I learned Svelte!
Working with a prolific SE in major companies (e.g Apple, AWS,...)

In couple of days I have managed to setup a test pipeline for Python code with absolute zero prior experience about testing whatsoever. Obviously there is still a lot to learn but looking up into testing has broaden my view about how software should be crafted
I learned Serverless Framework in couple of days and was able to refactor/improve the codebase by adding scripts, adding plugins foroffline support, remove unnecessary dependencies,..
I started to read more about testing and its benefit. And it has certain impact on my view about crafting a quality software

Hello from the other side
- weekly session with Harley about technical aspect of the project and how to improve it

- problem: there are many codebase using different technologies. Aldwin the new dev has little experience (6 months for Node, just getting use to React & Vue) so he would need more instruction on the complex task related to different services
- solution: Trang should analyze the ticket technical aspect & note what to pay attention too. Have general instruction also code review
- purpose: get Aldwin to understand technical aspects of the team service. Able to deliver easy to medium complex task both frontend and backend

- promote better communication across team:Â 
 1. bi-weeky talk with PM about what we do. 
 2. encourage member to share screen and ask question in stand up
 3. 100% team members have camera on in meeting"

- problem: APi gateways doesn't process request in lean manner. There are many redundancies. This create mental overhead for engineer, bugs and security risks 
- solution: define different gateways for API - authorization, payload validation, biz logic, etc. the gateways should only accept the info that they need. Document APi in Swagger
- purpose: better API structure & documentation. Faster to create new API

- writing runbooks: APIs docs
- enhance logging, test log in staging"

- problem: the SQL query for document list is slow
- solution: change query so the performance is better
- purpose: enhance user experience for faster page load

- writing runbooks: APIs docs
- enhance logging, test log in staging"

- last goal: write test for new APIs added; set up test data

- spend at least 3SPs each month to contribute to server testing. At least 10% of API should have test covered for each month

- problem: not able to deliver some main tickets at the end of sprint
- solution: split tickets & deliver small MVP based on Michael suggestion https://sleek-corp.atlassian.net/browse/SA-12652?focusedCommentId=40612
- purpose: to deliver all promised features according to quater plan"
